TopicTitle: Tyandi Command Pod Development - Trying to go for my first part!

Articles.Content:
Hello, [s]It's me... I'm in california dreaming of the things we used to be[/s] I am developing a nifty little command pod/station module that I call the Tyandi.
Info on the Tyandi so far: So it will fit a 2.5m form factor and be designed for anything from planetary bases to orbiters. It will have a glass dome at the top and a bottom part that will be either a service compartment or maybe some kind of docking port mounting points (I really don't know on this bit) and will carry four crew whilst being lighter than the Mk 1-2 command pod, the big kick-in-the-nuts downside is that it has no stack mounts on the top, and attatching things radially to the dome will be ugly as all heck. Don't ask me where the name came from. :)

The Tyandi will eventually be a part of a planned parts pack containing parts inspired by Chinese space technology (Tiangong, Shen Zhou) that will be aimed towards RSS/RO.

Pics coming soon...
